The goal of this project is to develop a Microsoft Word add-in and a Chrome browser extension that will perform transliteration from Crimean Tatar Cyrillic to Latin script, using the existing code for transliteration on https://github.com/qirimca/Transliterator . The add-in and the extension will allow users to select a text written in Crimean Tatar Cyrillic and convert it to Latin script according to the rules of the Crimean Tatar language. The add-in and the extension will also provide an option to reverse the transliteration from Latin to Cyrillic. The add-in and the extension will be compatible with the latest Microsoft Word and Chrome browser versions and will support Windows, Mac, and Linux operating systems. REQUIREMENTS FUNCTIONAL REQUIREMENTS The add-in and the extension will use the existing code for transliteration on https://github.com/qirimca/Transliterator as the core logic for converting between Cyrillic and Latin scripts. The add-in and the extension will provide a user interface allowing users to select a text written in Crimean Tatar Cyrillic and click a button to translate it to Latin script. The converted text will replace the original text in the exact location. The add-in and the extension will also provide a button to reverse the transliteration from Latin to Cyrillic if the user wants to undo the conversion or correct a mistake. The add-in and the extension will detect the language of the selected text and only perform the transliteration if the text is in Crimean Tatar. Suppose the text is in another language. In that case, the add-in and the extension will display a message informing the user that the tool cannot transliterate the text. The add-in and the extension will preserve the formatting and style of the original text, such as font, size, colour, alignment, etc. The add-in and the extension will handle standard exceptions and errors, such as invalid input, empty selection, network failure, etc., and display appropriate messages to the user. NON-FUNCTIONAL REQUIREMENTS The add-in and the extension will be easy to install and use, and follow the best practices and guidelines for Microsoft Word add-ins ( https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/office/dev/add-ins/quickstarts/word-quickstart ) and Chrome browser extensions ( https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/2714278?hl=en ). The add-in and the extension will be fast and responsive and perform the transliteration within a few seconds after the user clicks the button. The add-in and the extension will be secure and reliable and will not compromise the privacy or integrity of the users data or device. The add-in and the extension will be tested and verified for accuracy and quality, and will comply with the official rules of the Crimean Tatar language for transliteration. DESIGN ARCHITECTURE The add-in and the extension will consist of three main components: the user interface, the transliteration logic, and the communication layer. The user interface will be the part that the user interacts with and will provide the buttons and messages for selecting and converting the text. The user interface will be implemented using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc, following the design and layout of Microsoft Word and Chrome browsers. The transliteration logic will be the part that performs the actual conversion between Cyrillic and Latin scripts, and we will use the existing code for transliteration on https://github.com/qirimca/Transliterator . The communication layer will be the part that connects the user interface and the transliteration logic. It will handle the requests and responses between them online, while offline, it will use the latest downloaded logic. The communication layer, if needed, will use the HTTPS protocol and the JSON format to ensure the data transmission's security and reliability.

PROBLEM STATEMENT: I need Javascript that searches a web page for a specific text and highlights it with css. What makes this problem difficult: The solution must not modify the actual text in the HTML. NOTE ON EXAMPLES: DOUBLE POINTY BRACKETS INSTEAD OF POINTY BRACKETS Upwork does not allow me to use HTML elements in this text. therefore I use double pointy brackets (e.g. span). EXAMPLE Assume the page contains this HTML fragment: pThis is a paragraph with the word findme in it./p If I provide the search string "findme", I want this to be highlighted. Note that I cannot simply apply styling the p. In fact, there is no element to apply styling to that would allow me to highlight that word! EXAMPLE OF WRONG SOLUTION The obvious solution would be to modify the DOM like this: pThis is a paragraph with the word span class="highlight"findme/span in it./p However, this is not what I want! IS THIS EVEN POSSIBLE? Yes, it is. One possible solution would be to create DIV and to position it exactly over the text in question. There are also browser extensions like Grammaly or LanguageTools that manage to do this (Note that while these are browser extensions, this task has nothing to do with browser extensions). The most important one is line wrapping within the highlighted text. REQ-5: The highlighting itself must be a HTML element itself (e.g. span).
